docs.name: MaterialYesNoButtonsComponent
docs.comment:
A component for the two buttons horizontally next to each other, like yes/no, save/cancel, agree/not agree, etc.

Text on the buttons can be changed, they can also be raised. The 'yes' button can be optionally highlighted.

Basic text customization can be provided with directives like MaterialSaveCancelButtonsDirective that replaces yes/no with save/cancel.

To display buttons in reversed order add a reverse attribute.

inputs.name: disabled
inputs.comment:
Whether the buttons should be disabled.

Default value is false.

inputs.name: noAriaDescribedBy
inputs.comment: The description which will be set to no button's aria-describedby.

inputs.name: noAriaLabel
inputs.comment:
The text to be used as an ARIA label on the cancel button.

For example, Dismiss, Not now, etc. Defaults to null so screen readers will read the button text as the label.

inputs.name: noAutoFocus
inputs.comment:
Whether the no button should be auto-focused.

Default value is false.

inputs.name: noDisabled
inputs.comment:
Whether the no button should be disabled.

Default value is false.

inputs.name: noDisplayed
inputs.comment:
Whether the no button should be displayed.

Default value is true.

inputs.name: noText
inputs.comment:
The text to be shown on the cancel button.

For example, Dismiss, Not now, etc. Default value is No.

inputs.name: pending
inputs.comment:
When pending is true, the yes and no buttons are hidden, and a spinner is shown.

This should be used to indicate asynchronous actions, such as saving or validating input.

Default value is false

inputs.name: raised
inputs.comment:
Whether the buttons should be raised.

Default value is false.

inputs.name: yesAriaDescribedBy
inputs.comment: The description which will be set to yes button's aria-describedby.

inputs.name: yesAriaLabel
inputs.comment:
The text to be used as an ARIA label on the save button.

For example, Ok, Apply, etc. Defaults to null so screen readers will read the button text as the label.

inputs.name: yesAutoFocus
inputs.comment:
Whether the yes button should be auto-focused.

Default value is false.

inputs.name: yesDisabled
inputs.comment:
Whether the yes button should be disabled.

Default value is false.

inputs.name: yesDisplayed
inputs.comment:
Whether the yes button should be displayed.

Default value is true.

inputs.name: yesHighlighted
inputs.comment:
Whether the yes button should be highlighted.

Default value is false.

inputs.name: yesRaised
inputs.comment:
Whether the yes button should be raised.

Default value is false.

inputs.name: yesText
inputs.comment:
The text to be shown on the save button.

For example, Ok, Apply, etc. Default value is yes.

outputs.name: no
outputs.comment:
The callback that is to be invoked, when no button is pressed.

Published events are either KeyboardEvent or MouseEvent

outputs.name: yes
outputs.comment:
The callback that is to be invoked, when yes button is pressed.

Published events are either KeyboardEvent or MouseEvent

docs.name: MaterialSaveCancelButtonsDirective
docs.comment: Provides messages from yes/no buttons to be Save/Cancel.

docs.name: MaterialSubmitCancelButtonsDirective
docs.comment: Provides default messages from yes/no buttons to be Submit/Cancel.

docs.name: KeyUpBoundaryDirective
docs.comment: Marks a subtree of the dom that should handle key events for a BoundaryAwareKeyDirective implementation.

docs.name: EscapeCancelsDirective
docs.comment: If attached to the yes-no buttons it will listen for escape keyup event and trigger no action on it.
